titles.title: Armed Forces Tax Relief Act of 2007
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude from income taxation all compensation received for active service as a member of the Armed Forces of the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 3/19/2007--Introduced. Armed Forces Tax Relief Act of 2007 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude from gross income all compensation received for active service as a member of the Armed Forces, not including pensions and retirement pay. (Terminates the current limited exclusion from gross income for combat pay.)
